answers.text: Linards Grantiņš, Raimonds Bitenieks, and Mārtiņš Bariss.

qas.question: What group was the first to oppose the Soviet government publicly?
What party was Helsinki-86 in disagreement with?

context: The CTAG (Latvian: Cilvēktiesību aizstāvības grupa, Human Rights Defense Group) Helsinki-86 was founded in July 1986 in the Latvian port town of Liepāja by three workers: <a0_0>Linards Grantiņš, Raimonds Bitenieks, and Mārtiņš Bariss.<a0_0/> Its name refers to the human-rights statements of the Helsinki Accords. <a1_0>Helsinki-86<a1_0/> was the first openly anti-<a2_0>Communist<a2_0/> organization in the U.S.S.R., and the first openly organized opposition to the Soviet regime, setting an example for other ethnic minorities' pro-independence movements.[citation needed]
